newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: PRESS DIGEST - Ireland - November 5.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Ireland - November 5.

text.p: Following are the highlights of stories reported in the Irish press on Tuesday.
- An Irish-born butler, who inherited over five million dollars from his employer Doris Duke, is the centre of a murder investigation in Los Angeles after his body was found in his apartment.
- The Irish government is planning to force users of illegal animal growth promoters out of farming by cutting off livestock subsidies from the European Union.
- Bank of Ireland's U.S. associate company, Citizen's Financial Group announced a new U.S. $87 merger agreement with Boston-based Grove Bank.

- The Irish minister for Finance Ruairi Quinn said on Monday that Irish small business group ISME should drop its High Court action and join the national wage agreement talks. ISME took a court action because it said it was not being accorded full social partner status in the pay negotiations.
- Irish equity analysts expect President Clinton's probable victory in the U.S. election to create buoyancy in Dublin stocks by the end of the week.
